title: YA YA

description.plain:
“​YA YA” serves as a celebration of all the artists who toured the Chitlin Circuit, pushing the boundaries of music and nurturing the history to which she now pays tribute. Many great Black artists performed in these venues in the face of segregation in the music industry. Artists such as Ray Charles, Ella Fitzgerald, Aretha Franklin, Little Richard, The Jackson 5 and Tina Turner all had their time on the Circuit.

“YA YA” is COWBOY CARTER’s most blatantly political statement, as Beyoncé embodies the titular character and speaks about the need to “keep the faith” in the face of the harsh realities of living in America. This song features a sample of Nancy Sinatra’s “These Boots Are Made for Walkin'” and alludes to numerous musical styles and dances from the 1950s and 60s, the height of legal segregation in the United States.

The song is currently only available on the digital version of the album and is not a part of the physical album tracklist.

embed_content: Read “YA YA” by Beyoncé on Genius
recording_location: Westlake Recording Studios (Los Angeles, CA) and Kings Landing West (Los Angeles, CA)
